conclusion: Analyze sequence of events to determine collision and landing of object A.
Object A is positioned above the green surface, slightly to the left of the center.
Object A is moving downward due to gravity.
Object A collides with the block at the top-left position.
Upon collision, A deflects towards the right based on angle of impact and block rigidity.
After first collision, A collides with the block at the top-right position.
A experiences another deflection, pushed further to the right and slightly downward.
Following second collision, A moves downward due to gravity.
Deflections direct A towards the bottom-right area of the setup.
A lands near the bottom-right block, just beside it.
Object A will collide twice, first with top-left block, then top-right block, and land near bottom-right block.
